question: All of the following syndromes are seen with obesity except:
exp: Cohen syndrome - Cohen syndrome is Paternal inheritance always associated with obesity Carcinoid syndrome - Excess of 5 HT derivatives: Serotonin increase leads to secretory diarrhea & will Result in weight loss Prader willi syndrome - caused by deletion of chromosome 15 Sho stature, obesity, inappropriate laugh so called as happy puppets and intellectual disability.

question: Painless burn in hand is seen in:
exp: Syringomyelia is associated with Arnold Chiari malformation type 1 IOC: - MRI spine

question: The PR interval in ECG denotes?
exp: Atrial depolarization only - P- Wave Ventricular depolarization and ventricular repolarization - QT interval
opb: Atrial depolarization with A - V conduction

question: Which of the following is true about carcinoid tumor?
exp: Mc site for Carcinoid tumor = GI tract>Lungs (Bronchus) Option B = Presentation is hypertension & diaphoresis (it is not True because presentation of Carcinoid tumor is usually secretory diarrhea) Option D = Best Dx by elevated urinary Vanillylmandelic Acid levels. (No, it is done for Neuroblastomas)
opa: Occurs along structures derived from foregut
opc: Intestinal carcinoids are of high malignant potential
opd: Best diagnosed by elevated urinary vanillymandelic acid levels

question: Which of the following is not associated with pulmonary aery hypertension?

question: In which of the following condition is blood osmolality increased:
exp: Diarrhea = Loss of water leads to concentration in body SIADH = Dilutional hyponatremia Psychogenic Polydipsia = Dilutional condition Cerebral toxoplasmosis leads to SIADH which again result in dilution

question: Which of the following is the best investigation for acute gout?
exp: in Acute gout there is increase in value of uric acid but when acute gout attack sta, uric acid is not elevated in blood, but elevated in synol fluid. Acute gout- uric acid in synol fluid. Chronic Gout - S. Uric acid. Acute gout condition has crystallization of uric acid in the joint space IOC - uric acid in synol fluid (Joint Aspiration) These crystals exhibiting -vet birefringence in polarized light.

question: Which of the following leads to development of SIADH?
exp: Causes of SIADH = 1. CNS infection 2. Trauma 3. Meningitis 4. Encephalitis 5. Ectopic Ca tumor Option B: Pit Adenoma = Prolactinoma (increase prolactin), | GH Option C: Lithium = Causes Nephrogenic diabetic insipidus -Manifestation of SIADH- Dilutional Hypernatremia Treatment of SIADH = Vaptan tolvaptan

question: Which of the following condition should not considered if JVP rises on deep inspiration??-?
exp: JVP rises on deep inspiration is called as kussmaul's sign Kussmaul's sign is seen in all conditions where the right side of hea is not functioning properly; Ability of right ventricle to accommodate is decreased. In constrictive pericarditis -Right side of hea will not be functioning normally because there will be calcification. In restrictive cardiomyopathy - Right side of hea will not be functioning normally because there will be fibrosis. In complete Heart block causes CANON, A waves In Atrial fibrillation - Twitching Absent P wave in ECG; A wave absent in JVP Power | So not rise of JVP in atrial fib Remember: kussmaul's breathing associated Diabetic Ketoacidosis

question: Which of these is the best for management of methanol poisoning?
exp: Acamprosate + Naltrexone use for Alcohol Deaddiction Fomepizole - DOC = Methanol poisoning Fomepizole -DOC for ethylene glycol poisoning DOC for Ethylene glycol poisoning & for Anti-freeze agent ingestion Disulfiram = Alcohol craving

question: What is the incubation period of hepatitis B?
exp: 30-180 incubation period according to text books Hepatitis B Dane paicle Earliest evidence of infection Hbs. Ag+ (Surface antigen) First antibody to Appear IgM anti HBc. Ag+ HBs. Ag + IgM anti HBc. Ag + Acute Hep B

question: In a newly diagnosed case of sick child with type 1 diabetes mellitus (DM), insulin was given. Which of the following will increase:
exp: Option A - pH Rise to normal. we know DKA Leads to insulinopenia so we'll give insulin, insulin will Rise PH to normal. Option B - DKA Pt present with fast breathing (kussmaul sign), So when we treat patient, respiratory rate of pt. decrease to normal. Option C- Glucosuria is present in DKA, after giving insulin glucosuria will decrease Option D- Urine Osmolality decrease because after giving insulin sugar will not be in urine.

question: Which of these has no role in treatment of dangerous hyperkalemia?
exp: Option A - injecting calcium chloride Ca- Antagonize relaxant effect of K+ on hea Option B - Salbutamol: - will cause K+ influx into cell Option C - Hemodialysis = most effective method for hyperkalemia Option D -IV Soda bicarbonate = No role Note: most effective drug for hyperkalemia = insulin drip

question: Initial treatment for management of mild to moderate Crohn's disease is:
exp: Sulfasalazine is DOC for UC ulcerative colitis) UC exacerbation - Budesonide enema. (20 bloody stool / day)

question: Fatty liver with hepatomegaly is seen in:
exp: OPTION B: Metabolic syndrome - Obesity - Fatty liver Option A: Marasmus do not have hepatomegaly rather kwashiorkor will have hepatomegaly Option C: Wilson disease leads to Cirrhosis Option D: Nutmeg liver leads to Cirrhosis Best test for fatty liver = Gamma GGT Alcoholic liver disease + fatty liver - Best Test - SGOT / SGPT Ratio more than 2
